alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Suffolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 6:38PM EDT until July 29 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norton has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Suffolk County in eastern Massachusetts... East Central Middlesex County in northeastern Massachusetts... * Until 845 PM EDT. * At 638 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Boston, Cambridge, Quincy, Newton, Somerville, Waltham, Malden, Brookline, Medford, Revere, Everett, Chelsea, Watertown, Saugus, Belmont and Winthrop. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
